info.title: OmniAPI
info.description: This API provide convenient access to the OmniAPI functionality for developers.

post.description:
# Description

This method can be used in order to get the access token and refresh token for an account from the SiteID, Username and Password.

# Description

This method can be used in order to get the access token and refresh token for an account from the SiteID and Refresh Token.

get.description:
# Description

Through the following method, you can retrieve information on your current balance.

# Description

Through the following method, you can retrieve active subscription information per channel of the user.

post.description:
# Description

This method can request the cost of sending a simple SMS or Viber.

# Description

Using this method, you can retrieve the cost details of sending a simple SMS or Viber message for a specific iso2. The difference from the Cost Method is that this method returns for a specific iso2, the mcc and mnc.

# Description

This method creates an API Key for your subaccounts. Contact with Account Manager, in order to give you more information about how to get an API Key.Thanks to this method, you can provide your subaccounts with an API Key that they can use.

get.description: This method retrieves all blacklisted phone numbers.

post.description:
# Description
This method inserts a phone number to the blacklist. At least one of the SMS or Viber should be define.

delete.description:
# Description
This method removes a phone number from the blacklist.

parameters.name: phonenumber
parameters.description: Refers to the phone number of the recipient to be removed from Blacklisted. Do not use country code or + or 00.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Refers to the channel of the recipient to be removed from Blacklisted. Valid valudes are all, sms, viber.

500.description: Oops! Can't delete your record right now

get.description: This method retrieves the Contacts belonging to a specified list. The response includes paged results and the total records count.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The guid of the subscriber list

parameters.name: PageNumber
parameters.description: Refers to the the page number of the available data.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: Refers to the page record size of the response. The maximum page size. Number between 1 and 1000.

post.description: This method retrieves the Contacts belonging to a specified set of lists, using filters. The response includes paged results and the total records count.

post.description:
# Description

This method allows you to send text messages to one or multiple recipients simultaneously. The maximum number of recipients you can send at one time is 1000.

When the callbackUrl property is defined the system will call the URL for each message status.

# Type of SMS Messages

Through Yuboto API, you can send:

 - Simple SMS(up to 160 characters)
 - Flash SMS(up to 160 characters)
 - Unicode SMS(up to 70 characters)
 - Long SMS(more than 160 7bit characters or 70 Unicode characters)
 
 A simple SMS includes all the 7bit alphabet characters as defined by GSM 03.38.
 
 Some 8bit alphabet characters may also be included and sent as a simple SMS.These will count as 2 characters.
 
 These characters are:
 
| Description | Character |
|:-----------:|:---------:|
| CIRCUMFLEX ACCENT | ^ |
| LEFT CURLY BRACKET | { |
| RIGHT CURLY BRACKET | } |
| REVERSE SOLIDUS (BACKSLASH) | \ |
| LEFT SQUARE BRACKET | [ |
| TILDE | ~ |
| RIGHT SQUARE BRACKET | ] |
| VERTICAL BAR | | |
| EURO SIGN |  |

All the other characters included in the 8bit alphabet can only be sent as Unicode characters (SMS 70 characters).

For more information about Unicode characters, you can visit http://www.unicode.org/charts/

If you use small case Greek characters (8bit) in a non-Unicode format, then the system will automatically convert them into Capital Greek characters(7bit).

Long SMS is a text message longer than 160 characters or 70 characters for Unicode type.

Long SMS (more than 160 characters for 7bit messages and more than 70 characters for 8bit messages) will be concatenated, ensuring that a multi-part message is received as a single SMS message.This avoids the confusion of messages arriving in random order. This is accomplished through User Data Header (UDH) which is a binary structure at the start of a SMS.It specifies how the message should be formatted and processed and holds 7 characters of each message part.

If the end users mobile phone not supporting long SMS, then the message will be divided into multiple messages of 153 characters for 7bit SMS or 63 characters for 8bit SMS each (Maximum number of characters 2000).

If you choose to send a long SMS without previously notifying the system, then the system will limit it to 160 characters(simple SMS).

# Type of Viber Messages

Through Yuboto API, you can send:

 - Text Only
 - Image Only
 - Text & Action Button
 - Text, Image & Action Button
 - File
 - Video
 - Video & Text
 - Video, Text & Button
 - Video, Text, Action & Button
 - List
 - Carousel

# Request Examples

**SMS Request Example**

```json
{
    "dlr": "false",
    "callbackUrl": null,
    "option1": null,
    "option2": null,
    "contacts":[{
        "phonenumber": "3069XXXXXXXX"
    },{
        "phonenumber": "3069XXXXXXXX"
    }],
    "dateAndTimeToSend": null,
    "sms":{
        "sender":"TestSender",
        "text":" This is a test sms fallback",
        "validity":180,
        "typesms":"sms",
        "longsms":"false",
        "priority":1
    }
}
```

**Viber Request Example**

```json
{
    "dlr": "false",
    "callbackUrl": null,
    "option1": null,
    "option2": null,
    "contacts":[{
        "phonenumber": "3069XXXXXXXX"
    },{
        "phonenumber": "3069XXXXXXXX"
    }],
    "dateAndTimeToSend": null,
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 3,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "text": "This is a test viber message",
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0
    }
}
```

**Viber with fallback to SMS**

```json
{
    "dlr": "false",
    "callbackUrl": "https://my.exampleCallbackUrl.com/webhook",
    "option1": null,
    "option2": null,
    "contacts":[{
        "phonenumber": "3069XXXXXXXX"
    },{
        "phonenumber": "3069XXXXXXXX"
    }],
    "dateAndTimeToSend": null,
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 3,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "text": "This is a test viber message",
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0,
        "fallbackOnFailed":{
            "notDelivered":"true",
            "userBlocked":"true",
            "expired":"true",
            "error":"true",
            "rejected":"true"
        }
    },
    "sms":{
        "sender":"TestSender",
        "text":" This is a test sms fallback",
        "validity":180,
        "typesms":"sms",
        "longsms":"false",
        "priority":1
    }
}
```
# Request Examples of SMS & Viber for each message type

**SMS for Text Sms message**

```
    "sms":{
        "sender":"TestSender",
        "text":" This is a test sms fallback",
        "validity":180,
        "typesms":"sms",
        "longsms":"false",
        "priority":1
    }
```

**SMS for Two Factor (pin) authentication**

```
    "sms":{
        "sender":"TestSender",
        "text":" This is a test sms fallback",
        "validity":180,
        "typesms":"sms",
        "longsms":"false",
        "priority":1,
        "twofa":{
            "pinLength":5,
            "pinType":"NUMERIC",
            "isCaseSensitive":"false",
            "expiration":180
        }
    }
```

**Viber for Text only message**

```
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 3,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "text": "This is a test viber message",
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0
    },
```

**Viber with fallback options message**

```
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 3,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "text": "This is a test viber message",
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0,
        "fallbackOnFailed":{
            "notDelivered":"true",
            "userBlocked":"true",
            "expired":"true",
            "error":"true",
            "rejected":"true"
        }
    },
```

**Viber for image only message**

```
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 2,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "image": "https://www.myimageurl.com/myimage.jpg",
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0
    },
```

**Viber Text & Action button message**

```
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 1,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "text": "This is a test viber message",
        "buttonAction": "https://www.mybuttonaction.com",
        "buttonCaption": "click me and go to my action",
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0
    },
```

**Viber Text, Image & Action button message**

```
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 0,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "text": "This is a test viber message",
        "image": "https://www.myimageurl.com/myimage.jpg",
        "buttonAction": "https://www.mybuttonaction.com",
        "buttonCaption": "click me and go to my action",
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0
    },
```

**Viber for file message**

```
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 4,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "buttonAction": "https://www.myfilepath.com/myfile.doc",
        "fileName": "myfile.doc",
        "fileType": "doc",
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0
    },
```

**Viber for video message**

```
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 5,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "buttonAction": "https://videourladdress.com/video.mp4",
        "duration": 30,
        "fileSize": 10,
        "thumbnail": "https://www.myimageurl.com/myimage.jpg",
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0
    },
```

**Viber for video & text message**

```
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 6,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "text": "This is a test viber message",
        "buttonAction": "https://videourladdress.com/video.mp4",
        "duration": 30,
        "fileSize": 10,
        "thumbnail": "https://www.myimageurl.com/myimage.jpg",
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0
    },
```

**Viber for video, text & button message**

```
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 7,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "text": "This is a test viber message",
        "buttonAction": "https://videourladdress.com/video.mp4",
        "buttonCaption":"click me and go to video",
        "duration": 30,
        "fileSize": 10,
        "thumbnail": "https://www.myimageurl.com/myimage.jpg",
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0
    },
```

**Viber for video, text, action & button message**

```
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 8,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "text": "This is a test viber message",
        "buttonAction": "https://mysite.com/",
        "buttonCaption":"click me",
        "media": "https://videourladdress.com/video.mp4",
        "duration": 30,
        "fileSize": 10,
        "thumbnail": "https://www.myimageurl.com/myimage.jpg",
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0
    },
```

**Viber for list message**

```
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 9,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "text": "This is a test viber message",
        "list":{
            "options":{
                "option1": "Option 1",
                "option2": "Option 2",
                "option3": "Option 3",
                "option4": "Option 4",
                "option5": "Option 5"
            }
        }
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0
    },
```

**Viber for carousel message**

```
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 10,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "text": "This is a test viber message",
        "carousel":{
            "items": [
                {
                    "title": "Title 1",
                    "imageUrl": "https://mysite.com/image1.jpg",
                    "primaryButton": {
                        "label": "More",
                        "actionUrl": "https://mysite.com/action1/more"
                    },
                    "secondaryButton": {
                        "label": "Details",
                        "actionUrl": "https://mysite.com/action1/details"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "title": "Title 2",
                    "imageUrl": "https://mysite.com/image2.jpg",
                    "primaryButton": {
                        "label": "More",
                        "actionUrl": "https://mysite.com/action2/more"
                    },
                    "secondaryButton": {
                        "label": "Details",
                        "actionUrl": "https://mysite.com/action2/details"
                    }
                }
            ]
        }
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0
    },
```

**Viber for Two Factor (pin) authentication message**

```
    "viber":{
        "ViberMessageType": 3,
        "sender": "Test 2way",
        "text": "Your pin number for this viber message is {pin_code}",
        "validity":180,
        "expiryText":"This viber message expired",
        "priority":0,
        "twofa":{
            "pinLength":5,
            "pinType":"NUMERIC",
            "isCaseSensitive":"false",
            "expiration":180
        }
    },
```

# System Forwarded Callbacks

When callback is true (defined in the Octapush platform), Yubotos system will forward the final state info to the client. The information that the client will receive, it is possible for the user to pass it on dynamically to the system.

The message info will be forwarded through a get request to the callback URL. The following parameters will be included in the query string:

| Paremeter | Type | Description |
|:-----------:|:---------:|:---------:|
| sender | string | The message sender |
| receiver | string | The destination phone number |
| smsid | string | The unique id that the message has |
| status | int | The status code that the message has |
| statusDescription | string | See the provided table for a detailed description of status values |
| dlrDate | string (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS) | The date that the message delivered |
| channel | string | The channel with which the message was sent |
| option1 | string | The user-defined value that was passed to method send |
| option2 | string | The user-defined value that was passed to method send |

**Note:** In case the callback is false, then Yubotos system will not send to the client the final state info.

**Status Expired Callback**

An expired callback will be sent on iOS once the expiry text message is seen. On Android, the expired callback will be sent once the user is online again.

# Message Response Callback

In the cases of 2way & Session messaging the end-user may respond. This response can be sent to a predefined callback URL.A response callback example:

```
https://www.example.com/example?receiver=3069XXXXXXXX&dlrDate=2021-01-08 10:13:21&sender=Test%202way&userMessage=Test%20response%20message&smsid=xxxxxxxx
```

| Paremeter | Type | Description |
|:-----------:|:---------:|:---------:|
| sender | string | The message sender |
| receiver | string | The destination phone number |
| smsid | string | The unique id that the message has |
| dlrDate | string (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS) | The date that the message delivered |
| userMessage | string | The message of the end users response |

If additional callback data are predefined, then they will be appended to the query.

# File Response Callback

In the cases of 2way & Session messaging the end-user may respond with a file. The response can be sent to a predefined callback URL.The file is kept on the server for 7 days.A response callback example:

```
https://www.example.com/example?receiver=3069XXXXXXXX&dlrDate=2021-01-08 10:13:21&sender=Test%202way&downloadUrl=http://example.com/DownloadUserFile/?id=EAAAAO8LzuRF%2fEUV2UxZeH0BEK3FI3H1an3byKhHkrtuafKeuArzJRzmRrJMBPS0QGs86ANVJ2hXRP7P3d%2biELhpmUY%3d&smsid=E0CFD97F-01CB-4F82-8B8E-E825C7DE02B1&smsid=xxxxxxxx
```

| Paremeter | Type | Description |
|:-----------:|:---------:|:---------:|
| sender | string | The message sender |
| smsid | string | The unique id that the message has |
| dlrDate | string (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS) | The date that the message delivered |
| downloadUrl | string | The URL of the file to be downloaded. |

If additional callback data are predefined, then they will be appended to the query.

# User Subscribe / Unsubscribe Callback

When a user unsubscribes from the sender subscription lists, a response can be invoked to a predefined URL.

```
https://www.example.com/example?receiver=3069XXXXXXXX&dlrDate=2021-01-08 10:13:21&sender=Test%202way&status=5&statusDescription=unsubscribed
```

| Paremeter | Type | Description |
|:-----------:|:---------:|:---------:|
| sender | string | The message sender |
| receiver | string | The destination phone number |
| status | int | The status code that the message has |
| statusDescription | string | See the provided table for a detailed description of status values |
| dlrDate | string (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS) | The date that the message delivered |

If additional callback data are predefined, then they will be appended to the query.

For the time being this service is provided **only** for **Viber** subscribed Users.

# Values for status

| Status | Status Name | Channel |
|:-----------:|:---------:|:---------:|
| 1 | Viber or SMS delivered | Viber or SMS |
| 2 | Undelivered | SMS |
| 16 | Undelivered | SMS |
| 3 | Seen | Viber |
| 7 | Clicked | Viber |
| 9 | Subscribed | Viber |
| 10 | Unsubscribed | Viber |
| -1 | Rejected (No network) | SMS |
| -2 | Rejected (Phone length) | Viber or SMS |
| -3 | Rejected (No tariff) | Viber or SMS |
| -5 | Failed | Viber or SMS |
| -6 | Expired | Viber or SMS |
| -30 | Expired system | Viber or SMS |
| -10 | Blacklisted | Viber |
| -13 | Undelivered (Not Viber user) | Viber |
| -23 | Undelivered (Not suitable device) | Viber |
| -14 | Not delivered (User blocked) | Viber |
| -26 | Error (Viber not permitted) | Viber |

get.description:
# Description

This method retrieves information on sent text messages and check their status in real-time.

# Status of Messages

The following table shows the possible status of a message (SMS or Viber):

| Status | Viber | SMS | Description | Final Status |
|:-----------:|:---------:|:---------:|:---------:|:---------:|
| Sent | Yes | Yes | The message has been sent to the final network to be delivered | No |
| Pending | Yes | Yes | The state of the message is not yet known | No |
| Submitted | Yes | Yes | The message has been routed for sending | No |
| Scheduled | Yes | Yes | The message has been scheduled for sending in a future time | No |
| Fallbacksms | Yes | No | The message wasnt delivered via Viber and it has been forwarded for sending via SMS | No |
| Not Delivered  | Yes | Yes | The message was not delivered | Yes |
| Unknown  | Yes | No | The message took another status from the ones we have available | Yes |
| Error | Yes | Yes | Error during the sending process | Yes |
| Expired | Yes | Yes | The message wasnt delivered within the time frame weve set | Yes |
| Failed | Yes | Yes | Sending failed due to insufficient balance in your account | Yes |
| Rejected | Yes | Yes | A message is rejected when the system rejects its sending due to routing reasons. Wrong number or not supported termination to a specific network are common reasons | Yes |
| Canceled | Yes | Yes | The sending of the message has been canceled  | Yes |
| Seen | Yes | Yes | The recipient has seen the message | Yes |
| Clicked | Yes | Yes | The recipient has clicked a link in the message | Yes |
| Blacklisted | Yes | Yes | The recipients number is blacklisted  | Yes |
| Unsubscribed | Yes | Yes | The recipient clicked on the unsubscribed option | Yes |
| Blocked | Yes | No | The Viber Sender Id that sent the message has been blocked | Yes |

Some of the possible reasons for the failure of SMS delivery might be

 - Invalid telephone number
 - Telephone deactivated or switched off. In the last two cases, the SMSC holds the message for 3 days and before rejecting it, allows you to select a shorter time period (the variable validity of Sms)
 
Delivery fails when there are no available Credits to your account

Messages are rejected when the recipient of the SMS or Viber message has an invalid format or when your account or Yuboto platform does not support it.

Failed or Rejected messages are not charged (to your account).

Possible reasons for Viber Service Message non-delivery are:

 - Subscriber does not have the Viber app installed on his/her device.
 - Subscriber is not reachable within given TTL.
 - Subscriber has Viber app that does not support Viber Service Messages (e.g., Windows Phone OS version of Viber app).

# Description

This method retrieves all existing send/delivery reports for previous campaigns based on the recipients phone number.

# Description

This method validates the pin for a specific smsid for two-factor authentication messages.

# Description

Through the following method, you can cancel a scheduled message before the scheduled date and time. You can cancel sending a message up to three minutes before the time it is scheduled to send.
This method retrieves a list of all subscriber lists

post.description:
# Description
This method creates a new Trackable URL. 

The urlDescription can contains one or more fields from the following table.
| Variables | Description |
|:----------:|:-------------:|
| {phonenumber}  | Refers to the phone number of the recipient of the text message. |
| {first_name} | he contact's first name field value |
| {last_name} | he contact's last name field value |
| {title} | he contact's title field value |
| {email} | he contact's email field value |
| {option1} | he contact's option1 field value |
| {option2} | he contact's option2 field value |
| {option3} | he contact's option3 field value |
| {option4} | he contact's option4 field value |
| {option5} | he contact's option5 field value |
| {option6} | he contact's option6 field value |
| {option7} | he contact's option7 field value |
| {option8} | he contact's option8 field value |
| {option9} | he contact's option9 field value |
| {option10} | he contact's option10 field value |
| {option11} | he contact's option11 field value |
| {option12} | he contact's option12 field value |
| {option13} | he contact's option13 field value |
| {option14} | he contact's option14 field value |
| {option15} | he contact's option15 field value |
| {option16} | he contact's option16 field value |
| {option17} | he contact's option17 field value |
| {option18} | he contact's option18 field value |
| {option19} | he contact's option19 field value |
| {option20} | he contact's option20 field value |

This method creates a new Short Url based on a Trackable URL.

get.description: This method retrieves a trackable short url

post.description:
# Description
This method decrypts a new Trackable short URL encrypted value.

phonenumber.description: Refers to the phone number of the recipient to be added as Blacklisted. Use country code without + or 00.

sms.description: Indicates if the phonenumber is blacklisted for the SMS channel. If the value is true, then the phone number will be blacklisted for SMS channel, if the value is false it will not change the status of the SMS channel.

viber.description: Indicates if the phonenumber is blacklisted for the Viber channel.  If the value is true, then the phone number will be blacklisted for Viber channel, if the value is false it will not change the status of the Viber channel.

BlacklistedCreateRequest.description: Describes the parameters that the system will use in order to create a blackslited phonenumber.

sms.description: Indicates if the phonenumber is blacklisted for the SMS channel

viber.description: Indicates if the phonenumber is blacklisted for the Viber channel

BlacklistedCreateResponse.description: Represents the response returned after creating a blacklisted phonenumber.

sms.description: Indicates if the phonenumber is blacklisted for the SMS channel

viber.description: Indicates if the phonenumber is blacklisted for the Viber channel

title.description: Indicates the title of the carousel item.

imageUrl.description: Indicates the image url of the carousel item which is expected to be in png, jpeg or jpg format. The recommended image size is 215 x 185 pixels.

label.description: Indicates the text that will appear on the action button.

actionUrl.description: Indicates the URL that the users are directed to or the action performed when pressing the action button or tap on the image.

label.description: Indicates the text that will appear on the action button.

actionUrl.description: Indicates the URL that the users are directed to or the action performed when pressing the action button or tap on the image.

name.description: The name of the custom field

value.description: The value of the custom field

ContactCreateCustomFieldRequest.description: Contains all the information for a custom field

subscriberListGuid.description: Refers to the subscriber list unique Guid.

phonenumber.description: Refers to the phone number of the recipient

name.description: Refers to the name of the subscriber list.

surname.description: Refers to the surname of the subscriber list.

title.description: Refers to the title of the subscriber list.

address.description: Refers to the address of the subscriber list.

email.description: Refers to the email of the subscriber list.

option1.description: Refers to the option 1 of the subscriber list.

option2.description: Refers to the option 2 of the subscriber list.

customFields.description: A list of name and value for the custom fields.

pageNumber.description: Refers to the page number of the available data.

pageSize.description: Refers to the page record size of the response. The maximum page size is 1000. Number between 1 and 1000

filters.description: Refers to an array of conditions for filtering the search. Available condition keys : contain, startswith, endswith, greater, smaller, greaterorequal, notequal, notcontains.

networkName.description: The name of the network (e.g. VODAFONE - PANAFON Hellenic Telecommunications Company).

mcc.description: The mobile country code (MCC) consists of 3 decimal digits (e.g. 202).

mnc.description:
The mobile network code (MNC) consists of 2 or 3 decimal digits (for example MNC of 001 is not the same as MNC of 01). The first digit of the mobile country code identifies the geographic region as follows (the digits 1 and 8 are not used) :
 - 0 - Test networks
 - 2 - Europe
 - 3 - North America and the Caribbean
 - 4 - Asia and the Middle East
 - 5 - Oceania
 - 6 - Africa
 - 7 - South and Central America
 - 9 - Worldwide (Satellite, Air - aboard aircraft, Maritime - aboard ships, Antarctica)

cost.description: The cost of sending a simple SMS or Viber message to one or multiple recipients.

iso2.description: The ISO_3166-1_alpha-2 code of the country.

channel.description: The channel that the message will be sent (SMS or Viber). In case you have an **OMNI API Key** (you send SMS and/or Viber messages), you need to specify for which channel you want to learn the cost.If your channel is not OMNI, then this parameter is not required.
The channel that the message will be sent (SMS or Viber).

type.description: Indicates the type of your cost (e.g. credits or money).

costDetailsInfo.description: A list with all the details about the cost of sending a simple SMS or Viber message to one or multiple recipients.

networkName.description: The name of the network (e.g. VODAFONE - PANAFON Hellenic Telecommunications Company).

cost.description: The cost of sending a simple SMS or Viber message to one or multiple recipients.

iso2.description: The ISO_3166-1_alpha-2 code of the country. One of the Iso2 or Phnumber parameters is required.

phonenumber.description: Refers to the phone number of the recipient of the text message. One of the Iso2 or Phnumber parameters is required.

channel.description: The channel that the message will be sent (SMS or Viber). In case you have an **OMNI API Key** (you send SMS and/or Viber messages), you need to specify for which channel you want to learn the cost.If your channel is not OMNI, then this parameter is not required.
The channel that the message will be sent (SMS or Viber).

type.description: Indicates the type of your cost (e.g. credits or money).

costInfo.description: A list with all the details about the cost of sending a simple SMS or Viber message to one or multiple recipients.

apiKey.description: The unique API Key of the user

channel.description: The channel that the message will be sent (SMS or Viber).

name.description: The name of each custom field.

CustomFieldsListItemResponse.description: Contains all the information for each custom field

encryptionKey.description: The encryption key used to generate the encrypted value

encryptedString.description: The encrypted string that we need to decrypt

DecryptTrackableShortURLValueRequest.description: Describes the parameters that the system will use in order to decrypt a trackable short url value

decryptedString.description: The generated string after the decryption.

formGuid.description: The Guid of the Form Url which will be used in order to create the short Url.

FormGenerateShortUrlRequest.description: Describes the parameters that the system will use in order to generate a short url for a form

formType.description:
The type of the form. The possible values are the following:
 - Public
 - Personalized
 - Singup

published.description: True if the form is published.

paused.description: True if the form has been paused.

activePeriodEnabled.description: True if an active period from and active period to has been defined for the form. If the value of the field is true, then the form will be available only for the specified period.

activePeriodEnabledFrom.description: If the value of the field **ActivePeriodEnabled** is equal to true, then this field contains the beginning of the active period otherwise it contains the value null.

activePeriodEnabledTo.description: If the value of the field **ActivePeriodEnabled** is equal to true, then this field contains the ending of the active period otherwise it contains the value null.

expires.description: True if an expiration period in seconds has been defined in the ExpiresSeconds field. If the type of the form is Public then the time start from the form creation date and time otherwise the time starts when the personalized message sent to the recipient.

expiresInSeconds.description: If the value of the field **Expires** is equal to true, then this field contains the number of seconds until the for will be assumed expired.If the type of the form is Public then the time start from the form creation date and time otherwise the time starts when the personalized message sent to the recipient.

limitNumberOfUses.description: Define the maximum number of times that the form can be completed.

limitNumberOfUsesCount.description: Contains the current number of form completions

sendEmailNotification.description: True if we want an email notification to be sent to the account owner.

sendEmailNotificationEmails.description: If the value of the field **SendEmailNotification** is equal to true, then this field contains one or more comma separated emails which will receive the notification.

sendEmailNotificationAttachPDF.description: If the value of the field **SendEmailNotification** is equal to true, then this field contains a value defining if the notification will contain a pdf with the forms results.

created.description: The date and time that the form created

FormListItemResponse.description: Contains all the information for each form

numberOfVisits.description: The number of times the short url have been used.

numberOfUniqueVisits.description: The number of individual uses used the short url

created.description: The date and time that the Short Url created.

expired.description: The date and time that the Short Url will expire

FormShortURLItemResponse.description: Contains all the information for the form short url

siteID.description: The SiteID which is associated with the Single sign-on installation

accessToken.description: The actual JWT access token used to authenticate API requests.

accessTokenExpiresIn.description: Time in seconds until the access token expires.

refreshToken.description: Token used to obtain a new access token without re-authenticating.

refreshTokenExpiresIn.description: Time in seconds until the refresh token expires.

notBeforePolicy.description: A timestamp (in seconds) before which the token is not valid. Used for token revocation policies.

tokenType.description: Typically "Bearer"  indicates how the token should be used in requests.

sessionState.description: Identifier for the user session in Keycloak.

siteID.description: The SiteID which is associated with the Single sign-on installation

accessToken.description: The access token used to authenticate API requests.

accessTokenExpiresIn.description: Time in seconds until the access token expires.

refreshToken.description: Token used to obtain a new access token without re-authenticating.

refreshTokenExpiresIn.description: Time in seconds until the refresh token expires.

notBeforePolicy.description: A timestamp (in seconds) before which the token is not valid. Used for token revocation policies.

tokenType.description: Typically "Bearer"  indicates how the token should be used in requests.

landingPageGuid.description: The guid of the landing page.

name.description: The name of the landing page.

published.description: True if the form is published.

publishDate.description: The date and time that the form published. The value is equal to Null in case that the landing page has not been published.

expirationDate.description: The date and time that the form will be expired. The value is equal to Null in case that the landing page expiration has not been defined.

totalUrls.description: The total number of urls that has been created using this landing page.

totalViews.description: The total number of views occurred to urls generated by this landing page.

uniqueViews.description: The total number of unique views occurred to urls generated by this landing page. This means that for each url we count only the first view and we ignore the next views.

created.description: The date and time that the landing page created.

LandingPageListItemResponse.description: Contains all the information for each landing page

text.description: The text that the message has.

status.description: The status that the message has.

dlrDate.description: The date the message was delivered.

submitDate.description: The date the message was sent.

The status of the pin

  - 0: Valid

name.description: The name associated with the attachment file.

contentType.description: The content type of the file.

fileContent.description: A bytes array representing the content of the file to be attached.

items.description: Gets or sets the list of items. The list must contain at least two items and at most five items.

phonenumber.description: Refers to the phone number of the recipient of the text message.

first_name.description: he contact's first name field value.

last_name.description: he contact's last name field value.

option3.description: he contact's option3 field value. In order to be able to use this value, the corresponding option must first be created on the Octapush platform.

cc.description: The list of email addresses to be added as CC (carbon copy) recipients.

bcc.description: The list of email addresses to be added as BCC (blind carbon copy) recipients.

from.description: The email address from which the email will be sent.

subject.description: The subject line of the email.

tag.description: The tag associated with the email for categorization or tracking.

replyTo.description: The reply-to email address for responses.

plainBody.description: The plain text body content of the email.

htmlBody.description: The HTML body content of the email.

priority.description: Indicates which channel has priority when it comes to OMNI messaging (default value is: 0).

attachments.description: A list of every file that needs to be attached to the email

notDelivered.description: Message is not delivered to the recipient.

userBlocked.description: The user blocks receiving messages from the sender.

expired.description: The message has not yet been delivered within the predefined period.

rejected.description: The message is rejected, as an example erroneous recipient.

SendMessageFallbackOnFailedRequest.description: FallbackOnFailed provides a set of options that define the conditions when a fallback to a different channel occurs.When a condition is set to true is gets activated and the systems checks if this condition is met a fallback action will be invoked to the next defined channel. When a condition is set a false its gets inactive, and the system does not check whether this condition is met.

options.description: Gets or sets the list of selectable options. The list must contain at least two options and at most five options.

contacts.description: This object contains information about the recipients of the messages. he maximum number of recipients you can send at one time is 1000.

dateAndTimeToSend.description: Indicates the date you wish to send the message. If this is omitted, the message is sent instantly

dlr.description: The flag indicates if delivery receipt request must be sent to customers application. (Default: false)

callbackUrl.description: When the message reaches its final state, a call to this url will be performed by Yubotos system with the messages delivery info. You can add a persistent callback URL in your account without sending a callbackUrl parameter each time you call the API. Contact support@yuboto.com in order to set your persistent callback URL under your account.

option1.description: User defined value that will be included in the call to the provided callback_url. Option1 parameters will be available for retrieve only if you pass dlr:true and a callbackUrl parameter

option2.description: User defined value that will be included in the call to the provided callback_url. Option2 parameters will be available for retrieve only if you pass dlr:true and a callbackUrl parameter

ignorePhoneValidation.description: Indicates if the validation of the phone number will occure.

ignoreEmailValidation.description: Indicates if the validation of the email will occure.

urls.description:
This object contains information about urls to be generated when sending messages
For each UrlObj you define, a different token of the form {Url1} for the first UrlObj, {Url2} for the second UrlObj, etc. will be created, which tokens you will be able to use in the SMS and Viber message. Regarding the creation of URLs, you should pay attention to the following:
 - All tokens that will be generated must be used in the Viber text or the SMS text in order for the message to be successfully sent.
 - For all the tokens that you will define in your message, there must be the corresponding UrlObj in order for the message to be successfully sent.

SendMessageRequest.description: Describes the parameters that the system will use in order to send a message.

channel.description: The channel that the message will be sent (SMS or Viber).

phonenumber.description: Refers to the phone number of the recipient of the message.

email.description: Refers to the email of the recipient of the message.

urls.description: A list that contains the Guids of the short Urls generated.

errorCode.description:
The error code for the specific contact. The error codes that the call can return are the following:
 - 0: The message was sent successfully
 - 1: A general error occurred when sending the message
 - 2: An undefined custom field was used
 - 3: URL generation mechanism has not configured properly.Please contact the system administrator
 - 4: Trackable Guid not found
 - 5: Trackable URL generation failed
 - 6: Landing page Guid not found
 - 7: Landing page URL generation failed
 - 8: Form Guid not found
 - 9: Form URL generation failed
 - 10: Unsubscribe URL generation failed

SendMessageResponse.description: Contains all the information for each message

sender.description:
SMS originator (sender) that will be displayed on the mobile devices screen.
 - Alphanumeric origin, max. 11 characters
 - Numeric origin, max. 20 characters

text.description:
The text of the message.
If two-factor authentication is activated TwoFa, is mandatory that **{pin_code}** is included in this string. This placeholder will then be replaced with the generated pin.

validity.description:
If the SMS is not delivered directly, this variable indicates the number of minutes for which the message will remain active, before being rejected by the SMSC. 
 - default : 1440 (1 Day).
 - Min Value: 30. 
 - Max Value: 4320 (3 days).

typeSMS.description:
Indicates the type of message you wish to send. 
 - sms (default)
 - Flash
 - unicode

longSMS.description: Indicates if the message can be over 160 characters. It applies only to standard type SMS.

priority.description: Indicates which channel has priority when it comes to OMNI messaging (default value is: 0).

pinLength.description:
The length of the pin to be generated.
 - Min: 4
 - Max: 32

pinType.description:
Accepted values:
 - ALPHA (PQRST)
 - ALPHA_ALPHA_LOWER_NUMERIC (Pg3Gh)
 - ALPHA_NUMERIC (hEQsa)
 - NUMERICWITHOUTZERO (5443)
 - NUMERIC (54034)

isCaseSensitive.description:
Whether the pin should be case sensitive (alpha, alphanumeric).
If false, the case sensitivity would not be checked when validating, if true, the code for validation needs to be entered exactly as provided.

expiration.description:
The time the pin will be active.
 - Min: 60 (seconds)
 - Max: 600 (seconds)

urlType.description:
Accepted values:
 - trackable
 - landing_page
 - unsubscribe
 - form

trackableGuid.description: In case of a trackable url type, the trackable url identifier which will be used for the url generation. The GetTrackableUrls endpoint can be used in order to retrieve a list of all the trackable urls.

landingPageGuid.description: In case of a landing page url type, the landing page identifier which will be used for the url generation. The GetLandingPages endpoint can be used in order to retrieve a list of all the landing pages.

formGuid.description: In case of a form url type, the form identifier which will be used for the url generation. The GetForms endpoint can be used in order to retrieve a list of all the forms.

sender.description:
Viber message originator (sender) that will be displayed on the mobile devices screen.
 - Alphanumeric origin, max. 28 characters

text.description:
The Viber Service Message text. Length can be up to 1000 characters. VIBER text can be sent alone, without a button or image.
When factor authentication is activated TwoFa, is mandatory and **{pin_code}** must be included in the string. This placeholder will be replaced with the generated pin.

validity.description:
If the Viber message is not delivered directly, this variable indicates the number of seconds for which the message will remain active, before being rejected.
 - default : 86400 (1 day)
 - Min Value: 30. Recommended minimum for TTL from Viber is 60 seconds.
 - Max Value: 1.209.600 (14 days). 
 Recommended minimum for TTL from Viber is 60 seconds.

expiryText.description: Relevant for the iOS version of Viber application (iPhone users only). This is the text that will be displayed if Viber Service Message expires.

buttonCaption.description: A textual writing on the button. The maximum length is 30 characters. The VIBER button can be sent only if Viber Service Message contains text.

buttonAction.description:
The link of button action. The maximum length is 255 characters. (Set as the URL of the file when sending a file message or Set as the URL of the video when sending Video, Video & Text or Video, Text & Button).
Required when sending file message.

image.description: The URL address of image sent to end-user. The VIBER image can be sent only alone or together with text and button.

fileType.description:
The type of file to be sent. Allowed types:
 - Documents: doc, docx, rtf, dot, dotx, odt, odf, fodt, txt, info
 - PDF: pdf, xps, pdax, eps
 - Spreadsheet: xls, xlsx, ods, fods, csv, xlsm, xltx
Required when sending file message.

fileName.description:
The name of the file to be downloaded. Maximum length 25 characters.
Required when sending file message.

duration.description:
The duration of the video in seconds. Max value is 600 seconds
Required when sending Video message

fileSize.description:
The size of the video in MB. Max value is 200MB
Required when sending Video message

thumbnail.description:
The URL address of image sent as thumbnail of the Video. Max length of the URL is 1000 characters
Required when sending Video message

media.description:
The media URL which represents the location of the video
Required when sending Video message

priority.description:
Indicates which channel has priority when it comes to OMNI messaging (default value is: 0).
Required when sending video, text, action and button message

serviceType.description:
Indicated the service type of the request.
 - 1: OneWay
 - 2: TwoWay
 - 3: Session

disableClickEvent.description: Indicates whether the system will immediately redirect to the buttonAction link or whether there will be an intermediate movement to record the click event.

name.description: Refers to the name of the subscriber list.

SubscriberListCreateRequest.description: Describes the parameters that the system will use in order to create a trackable url.

subscriberListGuid.description: The Guid for the Subscriber List generated.

SubscriberListCreateResponse.description: Represents the response returned after creating a subscriber list.

subscriberListGuid.description: The guid of the subscriber list.

name.description: Refers to the name of the subscriber list.

subscriberListGuid.description: The id of each subscriber list.

name.description: The name of each subscriber list.

activeContacts.description: The number of active contacts in the list.

totalContacts.description: The total number of contacts in the list (active & inactive).

SubscriberListListItemResponse.description: Contains all the information for each subscriber list

numberOfVisits.description: The number of times the short url have been used.

numberOfUniqueVisits.description: The number of individual uses used the short url

created.description: The date and time that the Short Url created.

expired.description: The date and time that the Short Url will expire

TrackableShortUrlItemResponse.description: Contains all the information for the trackable short url

urlDescription.description: A user friendly name for the new Trackable URL. The parts of url that we want to encrypt

url.description: The template of the URL which will be used to generate the final URL

maxDuration.description: The expiration in number of days. 1  3650

maxUniqueIps.description: The maximum number of unique IPs that can open the short URL. 1- 500

urlEncryption.description: Enables or disables URL encryption. If we set to true, we must define the UrlEncryptionKey value

urlEncryptionKey.description: The key value which will be used to Encrypt and Decrypt the values.It must be 16 characters string.

TrackableUrlCreateRequest.description: Describes the parameters that the system will use in order to create a trackable url must be enclosed between two pairs of #.

trackableUrlGuid.description: The Guid for the Trackable url generated.

first_name.description: he contact's first name field value

last_name.description: he contact's last name field value

trackableGuid.description: The Guid of the Trackable Url which will be used in order to create the short Url.

TrackableUrlGenerateShortUrlRequest.description: Describes the parameters that the system will use in order to generate a short url for a trackable url

trackableShortUrlGuid.description: The Guid for the Trackable Short URL generated.

trackableUrlGuid.description: The guid of the trackable url.

name.description: The name of the trackable url.

url.description: The template of the URL which will be used to generate the final URL.

published.description: True if the form is published.

publishDate.description: The date and time that the form published. The value is equal to Null in case that the trackable url has not been published.

expirationDate.description: The date and time that the form will be expired. The value is equal to Null in case that the trackable url expiration has not been defined.

totalUrls.description: The total number of urls that has been created using this trackable url.

totalViews.description: The total number of views occurred to urls generated by this trackable url.

uniqueViews.description: The total number of unique views occurred to urls generated by this trackable url. This means that for each url we count only the first view and we ignore the next views.

created.description: The date and time that the trackable url created.

TrackableUrlListItemResponse.description: Contains all the information for each trackable url

channel.description: The channel to use for the package.

initialBalance.description: The original balance that the package had when it was initialized.

balance.description: The current balance of the package.

startDate.description: The date and time the package was activated for use.

endDate.description: The date and time the package will expire

currentBalance.description: Your current balance in credits or money, including the limitBalance.

actualBalance.description: The actual balance in credits or money.

limitBalance.description: This is your accounts overdraft. To what limit your account can send messaging (default value is: 0).

type.description: The type of your balance based on the users configuration (e.g. credits or money).

subscriptions.description: The list of type Subscription with all your active subscriptions.

packages.description: The list of type Package with all your active packages

channel.description: The channel to use for the subscription.

initialBalance.description: The original balance that the subscription had when it was initialized.

balance.description: The current balance of the subscription.

startDate.description: The date and time the subscription was activated for use.

endDate.description: The date and time the subscription will expire

subscriptions.description: The list of subscriptions and channels.

senderName.description: The sender Name of subscription channel.

initialBalance.description: The initial balance of the subscription.

currentBalance.description: The current balance of the subscription.

dateStart.description: The initial starting date of the subscription.

dateEnd.description: The expiration date of the subscription.

formShortURLGuid.description: The Guid for the Form Short URL generated.

ApiKey.description: Enter your API key as a base64 encoded value in the format: Basic <apiKey>
ApiKey.name: Authorization
